alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a phenylmethtylamine moiety, which consists of a phenyl group substituted by an methanamine.
alternative_parents.name: Phenylmethylamines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing benzylamine, which consists of a benzene group attached to an amine group.
alternative_parents.name: Benzylamines

alternative_parents.description: Alkylamines in which the alkyl group is substituted at one carbon atom by an aromatic hydrocarbyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Aralkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Organonitrogen compounds containing a quaternary ammonium substituted with four alkyl chains.
alternative_parents.name: Tetraalkylammonium salts

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a bromine ion.
alternative_parents.name: Organic bromide salts

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Aromatic compounds containing one monocyclic ring system consisting of benzene.
class.name: Benzene and substituted derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as alkyldimethylbenzylammonium halides. These are organic compounds consisting of a quaternary ammonium group substituted with a benzyl group, two methyl groups as well as an alkyl chain. These compounds also contain a halogen ion and have the general structure R1[N+](CH3)(CH3)R2.[X-], where R1 = benzyl group, R2 = alkyl chain, and X = halogen atom.

direct_parent.description: Organic compounds consisting of a quaternary ammonium group substituted with a benzyl group, two methyl groups as well as an alkyl chain. These compounds also contain a halogen ion and have the general structure R1[N+](CH3)(CH3)R2.[X-], where R1 = benzyl group, R2 = alkyl chain, and X = halogen atom.
direct_parent.name: Alkyldimethylbenzylammonium halides

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic compounds consisting of a quaternary ammonium group substituted with a benzyl group, two methyl groups as well as an alkyl chain. These compounds also contain a halogen ion and have the general structure R1[N+](CH3)(CH3)R2.[X-], where R1 = benzyl group, R2 = alkyl chain, and X = halogen atom.
subclass.name: Alkyldimethylbenzylammonium halides

superclass.description: Aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.
superclass.name: Benzenoids
